channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Commodities for the Long Run?
item.description: Asset classes such as commodities have historically had notable diversification benefits for longer-term investors who are concerned with inflation.

item.title: Wall Street titan warns that job titles come and go but the only thing that matters is character
item.description: TIAA CEO Thasunda Brown Duckett insists she is not her title. ‘I earned it, but I don’t own it.’

item.title: Vanguard’s Former OCIO Clients Must Stand Their Ground
item.description: Vanguard's OCIO clients should be wary of the higher-fee active funds and alternative investments that are now open to them.

item.title: VanEck and 21Shares file for Solana ETFs—a ‘bet’ on a Trump victory
item.description: The SEC has until March to decide on Solana ETFs. The real deadline, however, will be November's election.

item.title: Are Your Data Governance and Management Practices Keeping Pace with the AI Boom?
item.description: No matter how sophisticated and expensive a firm's AI tools are, it should not forget that the principle “garbage in, garbage out” (GIGO) applies to the entire investment management process.

item.title: Barcelona residents are so fed up with tourism they’re squirting visitors with water guns as they try to enjoy their meals
item.description: Locals argue that tourism isn't helping with soaring housing costs, precarious employment, and a lower quality of life.

item.title: Book Review: Default
item.description: Argentina’s debt restructuring tests the theoretical limits of chaos theory. Gregory Makoff's feat is to build his narrative as a thriller without losing the detailed facts valued by specialists.

item.title: Retailer bans personal checks after rise in fraud
item.description: Walmart, Macy’s and Kohl’s are among the retailers that still accept personal checks at their stores.

item.title: Conundrum Cubed: Scope 3 for Financials
item.description: Proxy data and estimates are likely to play an important role in plugging disclosure gaps in financial institutions' Scope 3 emissions.

item.title: Microsoft ordered employees in China to only use iPhones due to security threats
item.description: The move is the latest example of the U.S. and China banning each other's tech products as the two superpowers build diverging digital ecosystems.
